column1: The Shakespeare society of New York
column2: which is really about the only useful literary organization in this country
column3: is making vigorous efforts to redress an old wrong and atone for a long neglect. Sunday
column5: it held a meeting at the Poe cottage on Kingsbridge road near Fordham
column6: for the purpose of starting an organized movement to buy back the cottage
column7: restore it to its original condition and preserve it as a memorial of Poe. So it has come at last. After helping build monuments to Shelley
column8: Keats and Carlyle we have at last remembered this man
column9: the greatest of our poets and the most unhappy. I am glad that this movement is in the hands of American actors
column10: for it was among them that Poe found his best friends and warmest admirers. Some way he always seemed to belong to the strolling Thespians who were his mother's people.
